Class Assemblage

A class that manages Assemblages, including AssemblyObjects, their Topology, HeuristicsSettings, ExogenousSettings, and all related data.

CheckWorldZLock

Gets or Sets the check for absolute Z direction lock. if True, only candidates whose referencePlane Z axis is parallel to the World Z axis (fixed up direction) are selected

RetrieveCandidates()

Retrieve the CandidateObjects for the current iteration

Declaration
public bool RetrieveCandidates()
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

True if at least one suitable candidate has been found, False otherwise
Remarks

This function sifts candidates filtering invalid results (i.e. collisions, environment), eventually compiling lists of: i_validRulesIndexes, CandidateObjects, i_candidatesNeighAInd

TryGetReceiverAndCandidates()

A virtual method that tries to retrieve a valid receiver and compile related list of candidates

Declaration
public virtual bool TryGetReceiverAndCandidates()
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

True if a valid receiver is found, False otherwise
Remarks

The method is virtual, so it can be customized with an override

Update()

Update method

Update is composed by the following steps:

  1. receiver selection (where do I add the next item?)
  2. rule selection (which one and how?)
  3. new object addition to the assemblage
  4. assemblage status update

Declaration
public virtual void Update()
Remarks

The method is virtual, so it can be customized with an override

Examples

This is the standard base implementation:

public override Update()
{
   // 0. reset iteration variables
   ResetIterationVariables();
   AssemblyObject newObject;
   // 1. receiver selection and candidates retrieval attempt
   // if there are no available candidates return
   if (!TryGetReceiverAndCandidates()) return;
   // 2. rule selection
   Rule rule = SelectRule(CandidateObjects, out newObject);
   // 3. new object addition
   AddValidObject(newObject, rule);
   // 4. Assemblage status update
   Utilities.ObstructionCheckAssemblage(this, newObject.AInd, i_candidatesNeighAInd[i_senderSeqInd]);
}
